title: The vertices of the base of an isosceles triangle lie on a parabola roughly y2=4x and the base is a part of the line roughly y=2x−4. If the third vertex of the triangle lies on the roughly x-axis, what are its coordinates? - Quora

response.answer_text: Solving y^2=4x and y=2x-4 simultaneously, Y=4 or -2 and corresponding x= 4 or 1 The two base vertices are (4,4) and (1,-2) Let 3rd vertex by (h,0) being in x axis Being Isosceles triangle, equating distances from 3rd vertex, we have (x-4)^2+(4^2)=(x-1)^2+(-2)^2 x=9/2 Third vertex is(9/2,0) Three vertices are(9/2,0), (4,4) and (1,-2)
